metadata.feature_description: Access and view files in a user's personal folder

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify View Assets menu item visibility for admin

steps.action: Logged in as SuperUser and navigated to Users panel
steps.expected: Users panel opens with list of users
steps.actual: Users panel opened showing all authorized users

steps.action: Clicked on More menu (three dots icon) for Test Regular User
steps.expected: More menu opens showing View Assets option
steps.actual: More menu opened with View Assets option visible along with other options (View Profile, Change Password, etc.)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify error notification for user without assets

steps.action: Clicked View Assets for Test Regular User who has no files
steps.expected: Error notification should appear indicating user has no assets
steps.actual: Error notification appeared: 'Test Regular User does not own any assets.'

steps.action: Clicked View Assets for Claude TestUser who has no files
steps.expected: Error notification should appear indicating user has no assets
steps.actual: Error notification appeared: 'Claude TestUser does not own any assets.'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Open assets panel for user with files

steps.expected: SuperUser Account should appear in search results
steps.actual: SuperUser Account (host) found in search results

steps.action: Clicked More menu and selected View Assets for SuperUser
steps.expected: Assets panel should open showing the user's personal folder with files
steps.actual: Evoq.Assets panel opened successfully showing folder path 'USERS > 001 > 01 > 1' with multiple files including cavalier-logo.png, cavalier-tv.png, full-star.png, test_document.pdf, and others

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Admin access without explicit VIEW_ASSETS permission

steps.action: Verified admin (SuperUser) can see View Assets menu for all users
steps.expected: Admin should have access to View Assets without explicit permission
steps.actual: View Assets menu item visible for all users when logged in as admin. Code review confirmed: canViewAssets() returns true for isAdmin OR permissions.VIEW_ASSETS

observations: The View Assets menu option has fewer items for the SuperUser's own account (no Login As User, Delete User, Make Super User, Un-Authorize User options) since these actions cannot be performed on oneself
The user folder structure follows the pattern: Users/[folder_id_segment1]/[folder_id_segment2]/[user_id]
Error notifications auto-dismiss after a short time (approximately 2-3 seconds)
The Assets panel integrates with Evoq.Assets module and displays files in a grid view with thumbnails
Code suggests VIEW_ASSETS permission can be granted explicitly to non-admin users via permissions.VIEW_ASSETS setting
